pull.title: Add secp256k1_ec_pubkey_compress()
pull.body: Added general function to reserialize a public key, and added secp256k1_ec_pubkey_compress() after seeing https://github.com/bitcoin/secp256k1/issues/259

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

events.body: I'm not yet sure why travis failed, it was a seemingly unrelated check. Will take another look.

Ok - nothing major here, just added a function that does the opposite of `secp256k1_ec_pubkey_decompress()` Ended up removing the new function in eckey_impl.h - it wasn't really worth it as the code is just a few lines. 

Anyways, hope this proves useful enough to merge. I wouldn't push C code too often - any feedback/criticism would be welcome.

I added a test also, similar to how decompress is tested here: https://github.com/bitcoin/secp256k1/pull/263/files#diff-4655d106bf03045a3a50beefc800db21R1521
Please squash your last commit into the previous ones. All commits should result in a tree that passes tests, or we may break the ability to bisect.
Ok, just pushed them once more.
ACK, though addressing @apoelstra's nits would be nice.
Cool, rebased and addressed the above!
Tested ACK from me. (The `VERIFY_CHECK` thing is no big deal.)

events.message: Add secp256k1_ec_pubkey_compress(), with test similar to the related decompress() function.

comments.body: This function does not seem to exist.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,3 +24,4 @@ static int secp256k1_eckey_privkey_tweak_mul(secp256k1_scalar_t *key, const secp
 static int secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_tweak_mul(const secp256k1_ecmult_context_t *ctx, secp256k1_ge_t *key, const secp256k1_scalar_t *tweak);
 
 #endif
+
comments.body:
Can you rebase without this newline?

Normally I wouldn't complain but this is the only place you touch this file.
And this one, while you're rebasing anyway.
I wonder if we should `VERIFY_CHECK` this instead of returning the return value. Is there a way this can fail if the parsing was successful?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -24,3 +24,4 @@ static int secp256k1_eckey_privkey_tweak_mul(secp256k1_scalar_t *key, const secp
 static int secp256k1_eckey_pubkey_tweak_mul(const secp256k1_ecmult_context_t *ctx, secp256k1_ge_t *key, const secp256k1_scalar_t *tweak);
 
 #endif
+

@@ -260,9 +260,26 @@ SECP256K1_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(
   int compressed
 ) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(1) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(2) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(3) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(4);
 
+/** Compress a public key.
+ * In:     ctx:       pointer to a context object (cannot be NULL)
+ *         pubkeyin:  pointer to a 33-byte or 65-byte public key (cannot be NULL)
+ * In/Out: pubkeyout: pointer to a 33-byte array to put the compressed public key (cannot be NULL)

@@ -260,9 +260,26 @@ SECP256K1_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT int secp256k1_ec_pubkey_create(
   int compressed
 ) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(1) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(2) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(3) SECP256K1_ARG_NONNULL(4);
 
+/** Compress a public key.
+ * In:     ctx:       pointer to a context object (cannot be NULL)
+ *         pubkeyin:  pointer to a 33-byte or 65-byte public key (cannot be NULL)
+ * In/Out: pubkeyout: pointer to a 33-byte array to put the compressed public key (cannot be NULL)
comments.body: You're right. Could still be the same for decompress as well, I'll take a look now.
